snippet: In a ruling hailed by American steel makers, the Commerce Department says steel tubes and pipes from eight countries were being dumped on the United States market.
abstract: Commerce Dept says South Korean steel companies and those in seven other countries are illegally dumping low-cost steel pipes and tubing into the American construction market and will be subject to additional duties; decision, subject to ratification, is latest ruling in effort by steel industry to combat flood of cheep steel tubes that are used in oil and gas wells.
lead_paragraph: In a ruling hailed by American steel makers, the Commerce Department says steel tubes and pipes from eight countries were being dumped on the United States market.

headline.main: U.S. Targets South Korea Over Steel
headline.print_headline: U.S. Targets South Korea Over Steel
